title: Hamas releases two more hostages from Gaza
summary: The International Committee of the Red Cross said Monday that it facilitated the release of two more hostages identified as Yocheved Lifshitz and Nurit Cooper.

title: Risk of regional escalation raises tension on Israel-Lebanon border
summary: Israel has begun evacuating several communities in the area, while deploying tanks and carrying out air strikes. On the other side, Hezbollah has mobilized tens of thousands of men and is firing rockets and shells. One slip, one misfire, could start a fire that both sides would prefer to avoid.

title: Despite numerous international commitments, deforestation still increased by 4% in 2022
summary: In addition to deforestation, the degradation of forest ecosystems due to the consequences of climate change and timber harvesting had a major impact.

title: The EU and the UK diverge in strategies to regulate AI
summary: On October 24, the EU aims to finalize the Artificial Intelligence Act. In November, the UK and Japan will host AI summits. However, despite their shared interest in AI, national strategies vary.

title: Thierry Marx, Michelin-starred chef: 'In the hotel and restaurant industry, 200,000 permanent jobs are unfilled'
summary: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' the media-savvy chef and president of the hotel and catering employers' trade union reflects on the significant challenges facing the industry, including labor shortages and the Paris 2024 Olympics.

title: Rothko at the Louis Vuitton Foundation: When color pulsates
summary: The Paris exhibition, spanning from October 18, 2023, to April 2, 2024, faithfully embodies the American painter's approach. Coherent rooms, low-hanging paintings and excellent lighting create a remarkable sensory experience for visitors.

title: Brussels shooting: French police detain two suspects
summary: The suspects, who reside in the Paris region, appeared before a judge on Monday to assess the possibility of charging them with belonging to a terrorist organization.

title: China's foreign minister to visit Washington this week
summary: China's top diplomat, Minister Wang Yi, will come to Washington on Thursday for a three-day visit, the latest move by Washington and Beijing to keep high-level talks open amid tense bilateral relations.

title: Roshdi Sarraj, Palestinian journalist and fixer, killed by Israeli strike in Gaza
summary: The 31-year-old worked for the press and international NGOs for over ten years, including with Le Monde. Nearly 20 journalists have been killed in Gaza since October 7.

title: Macron to call for 'resumption of a genuine peace process' on Israel visit
summary: The French president will call for the 'resumption of a genuine peace process' for the creation of a Palestinian state during his visit, during which he will meet with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Argentina: Peronist candidate Sergio Massa holds back the far-right wave
summary: In Sunday's first round of the Argentinian presidential election, the center-left coalition candidate, Sergio Massa, beat the outsider Javier Milei. They will compete in a second round on November 19.

title: American autoworkers union expands strike, shuts down Stellantis plant
summary: United Auto Workers has been on strike since September 15, shutting down Ford, General Motors, and Stellantis factories, and has received President Biden's support.

title: $1 trillion in 2022: Multinationals continue shifting their profits to tax havens
summary: Despite an agreement on a global minimum corporate tax, multinational companies still transfer significant profits to tax havens, according to an EU Tax Observatory report.

title: Michel Duclos, former French ambassador: 'In a world without rules, all frozen conflicts risk erupting'
summary: Noting that the use of force is no longer taboo, the former diplomat argues for an acceleration of dialogue between the Global North and South in order to strengthen global security.

title: UN General Assembly to meet over Israel-Hamas war on Thursday
summary: The Security Council has so far failed to agree on a resolution concerning the war.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Cairo summit calls for humanitarian aid amid acute divisions between Europeans and Arabs
summary: The summit held in Egypt on Saturday failed to produce a joint declaration. Cairo denounced the West's 'incomprehensible hesitation' to condemn the deaths of Palestinian civilians under Israeli bombardment.

title: France announces sale of weapons to Armenia
summary: Yerevan has agreed to purchase radar systems from the French group Thales amid fears that Azerbaijan might seek to target southern Armenia, after having seized Nagorno-Karabakh.

title: UN departs new base in Mali's tense Kidal region
summary: The UN's withdrawal on Monday is the second in the Kidal region and the seventh in the country.
